about.description:
As a computer science graduate, I am an expert in technology and software development. I have a solid background in computer science theory and programming languages, and I am skilled to work on a wide variety of technology-related projects.
I specialize in web and mobile application development and have a strong ability to solve complex technical problems. I enjoy working in teams and collaborating with other developers to create innovative and high-quality solutions.
In addition to my academic background, I also have real-world work experience and have worked at different companies as a software developer. This has allowed me to acquire practical skills and work on real and challenging projects.

portfolio.tsSimple: A collection of packages to simplify your life. The most common packages contain simple functions that I have used in many of my projects. This way, I try to unify these functions in a repository and test them to avoid bugs.
portfolio.raspbot: Raspbot is a simple program to listen to the Telegram bot channel.
portfolio.ngxCards: A compilation of Angular components to display profile information for websites.

experience.agora:
I developed single-page web applications using the MEAN stack (MongoDB, Express.js, Angular, and Node.js).
I used MongoDB to manage large schema-less databases and Express.js to build APIs and web applications.
I worked with Angular to implement business logic and user interfaces for applications and used Node.js to run server-side code.
I was involved in the development of scalable and modern web applications using the MEAN stack.
experience.udc:
I participated in research projects at the university, using a wide range of technologies to develop prototypes and demos.
I collaborated with other researchers to develop and test concepts and theories using a variety of tools and languages.
I gained deep skills and knowledge in cutting-edge technologies through my work in university research.
I contributed to the development of innovative ideas and approaches in my university research projects.
